citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The principal investigator (PI) did not obtain veterinarian approval prior to administering a medication that was not listed in
the protocol approved by the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). A pig was under general anesthesia
for a procedure when its heart rate was noted to be elevated on two separate occasions (approximately one hour apart).
The PI administered medication to the pig to address the elevated heart rates; however, the medication used was not
listed in the IACUC-approved protocol. Additionally, the PI did not obtain veterinarian approval for use of this medication
either time it was administered. The medication used was appropriate for the medical situation and the pig had no
negative effects from the medication given.
A deviation from an IACUC-approved protocol, such as using an unapproved medication, could result in undesirable or
unexpected outcomes. The IACUC shall determine that significant changes in protocol activities meet the requirement of
consulting with the attending veterinarian or his or her designee prior to any changes. Correct by: December 1, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
